title: Thumbnail image not loading under certain conditions
content:
There is an issue with thumbnails not loading on certain webpages. I've tried a lot to solve this problem and found out that it doesn't reproduce in Safe mode.

This doesn't happen when I first visit a web page. Occurs when I browse other pages of the website or refresh multiple times. (But, closing the window and accessing the page again will solve the problem.)

It doesn't print out any special error messages, it just appears to be still loading. (Checking in the console, status code 200 (OK) is not returned and it shows that it is still being requested.)

However, regardless of whether or not the image is actually being loaded, the NS_BINDING_ABORTED error is thrown in the thumbnail image URL.

I've tried a lot of methods like turn off hardware acceleration, switch to the default theme, disable all extensions, turn off AdGuard (on Windows), turn off DNS-over-HTTPS feature, and disable to force HTTPS, but that didn't fix the problem.

Only in safe mode the problem was resolved.

Additionally, there are no problems with Chrome browser. When a problem occurs in the Firefox browser, if I refresh the same page in Chrome, it loads fine. So I guess it's not a network issue.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-extensions-themes-to-fix-problems I tried to solve the problem by referring to this article, but it did not say what settings were changed other than those described above when using Safe mode.

So I would like to know which settings change when I enable safe mode.
creator: flyingdora

title: Roboform
content: I have used Roboform password manager with FF for years. Within the last 6 months, Roboform's toolbar no longer automatically displays below FF when I open FF. I have to force it to by going into RF options and dragging the RF icon onto FF (see attached screen shot). As shown in the image, RF and/or FF doesn't even think RF is installed! But it is. I've contacted RF multiple times, and they claim they're working on it. I wonder if anyone in the FF community has the same problem. Thanks for any help. Steve

title: Can not play videos at one website
content:
I have what I think is a specific video problem. Videos from the Washington Post get the message “This video is currently not available”. Other videos, e.g. from the New York Times do work. Washington Post videos work with Chrome and Opera.

The problem is on a new Dell Inspiron 5502 running Windows 10 and Ubuntu with dual boot. The problem only occurs under Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS. It does not occur under Windows Firefox.

The current Firefox is 84.0.2. The problem did occur under 84.0 but I didn’t have time to pursue it.

The add-ons manager under extensions has no entries. Under plugins there is only “OpenH264 Video Codec provided by Cisco Systems”.

Under preferences, performance, hardware acceleration is not selected and the content process limit is left at 8.

Running in safe mode does not help.

I had a different video problem on a pair of the hardware visible at https://support.mozilla.org/questions/1320396?utm_campaign=questions-reply&utm_source=notification&utm_medium=email#answer-1381141 This is a different machine and a different problem.

title: Removal of "Other Bookmarks" from Menu selection "Bookmarks"

Attempting to find some HELP period is next to impossible using this setup as you have it set. Finally found what was said to be a "SOLUTION" and it did NOT work for my setup, NO HELP at all! I also posted a possible work around for the additional issues with that one problem with the "Other Bookmaks" as it will NOT allow me to DELETE that folder. On top of this issue, every now and then that "Other Bookmarks" duplicates itself and I have had eighteen or more copies of that folder, if any one of those extra copies is removed they are all removed including the one copy that cannot be removed is "STRIPPED" of any saved bookmarks within that folder.

I recommended that anyone with this issue to create a special bookmark folder to save any bookmarks within that "Other Bookmarks" folder before removing any of the copies and save your bookmarks from that "Other Bookmarks" folder. Now I cannot find my original posting to see if there are any updates. When doing what you call a search for FIREFOX only still comes up with over 2K entries and cannot take the time to review them all. This system is a NIGHTMARE to use to find anything. title: How to disable automatic downloads on Firefox
content: I am a medical professional and use an electronic medical record website to submit electronic prescriptions. On this particular website, I keep getting automatic downloads of coupons that open up a PDF on my Mac. How do I stop the website from doing automatic downloads? I don't have this issue on other websites. In Chrome, I don't have this issue and only get the download if I specifically click on the coupon link. The website customer support said it's an issue with Firefox, not their website. How do I at least stop getting my Mac to open up downloaded PDFs automatically?

title: firefox portable as default browser
content:
I run Firefox in portable mode in Windows 10. It works wonderfully. However, when i click on web links outside of FF, it loads Chrome. So in FF I go to options and set it as a default. In "default apps" it shows up there. But Because I am running FF portable, by setting it as default browser, it creates a new profile on c:\users\username . And loads a whole new instance of FF. That is not what I would like to happen.

Is there a way to set it up so that when I click a link in an email, it will load the FF from the portable instance? using the profile within the portable directory. Usually I always have FF open. It is never closed.

title: Lockwise
content: Respecto de Lockwise. Podría diseñarse un sistema de ingreso que permita iniciar sesión (para varios usuarios), se carguen los datos y que cada al cerrar la sesión la información no quede almacenada. Regarding Lockwise. An entry system could be designed that allows logging in (for several users), data is loaded and each time the session is closed the information is not stored.
creator: zeus.grafe

title: Lockwise
content: Con relación a Lockwise sugiero que se pueda administrar y organizar los inicios de sesión a gusto del usuario, esto es, colocar nombres de dominios, clasificarlos y ubicarlos en directorios o carpetas y otras opciones. Regarding Lockwise, I suggest that logins can be managed and organized to suit the user, that is, place domain names, classify them and place them in directories or folders and other options.
creator: zeus.grafe

title: Sync sincronización
content: Spanish ¿Por qué se puede sincronizar marcadores y otros datos, pero no es posible sincronizar los sitios favoritos y destacados? Deberían pensar en facilitar esta opción también. Inglés Why can I sync bookmarks and other data, but my favorite and featured sites can't sync?
creator: zeus.grafe

title: Address Autofill VANISHED!
content:
After wiping my Mozilla Firefox profile data everywhere, including AppData Local and Roaming profile directories, Firefox autofill stopped saving and/or synchronizing my address information. The address autofill options disappeared entirely from Firefox "Privacy & Security" section. I checked about:config, which had "services.sync.engine.addresses" and "services.sync.engine.addresses.available" set to "False". I set them to "True", but that only restored the address synchronizing setting in Firefox "Sync" section, not in "Privacy & Security" section. Syncing did not restore the address autofill options for "Privacy & Security" section and neither did changing other autofill and address-related entries in about:config. Starting a fresh new profile yet again didn't help.

Could this be caused by network-wide block of "location.services.mozilla.com" ? That domain became blocked a while back and there was no way around it, not even with DNS-over-HTTPS, but back then address autofill was working just fine without accessing that domain.

How can I bring back the address autofill portion of "Privacy & Security" section???
creator: SpektorCyrax
